page.title: 07THE COKING PLANT WINGERWORTH
page.content: When it was built in 1956 the{NCB {Avenue Carbonisation and Chemical {Plant}was the largest fully integrated coking and chemical works in Europe. Locally it is considered to be an eye-sore, but it does help the community, offering employment to over 600 people. Also the high rates it has to pay to the council greatly reduces the amount paid by each household in the county. Originally the Plant was given a life span of 20 years, so it should be closing in 1986 however no decision has yet been made. The whole complex is made up of the following parts: {a)}Coke ovens with coal and coke handling plants {b)}Chemical plant {c)}Tar plant { d)}Benzole plant
